intro: Pachymitus cardaminoides var. dasycarpus, commonly known as the hairy-fruit pachymitus, is a perennial herb native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, hairy, spherical fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
